required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Cognitive Rehabilitation for Individuals With Parkinson's Disease and MCI

lead_sponsor.agency: VA Office of Research and Development

clinical_study.source: VA Office of Research and Development

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate the effectiveness of a novel compensatory cognitive rehabilitation program for individuals with Parkinson's disease (PD) and mild cognitive impairment (MCI).

detailed_description.textblock: Eligible study participants will be randomly assigned to one of two interventions: 1) Cognitive Rehabilitation (Cognitive Symptom Management and Rehabilitation Therapy for Parkinson's disease; CogSMART-PD) or 2) Supportive Care. Interventions are held within a group format consisting of approximately 5 individuals with PD. Groups will meet once per week for 1.5 hours over a 10-week period. Neuropsychological testing will be administered pre- and post-intervention as well as 6- and 12-months after the intervention.

study_design_info.masking_description: Investigator and Assessor are blinded to group assignment.

primary_outcome.measure: Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale-IV (WAIS-IV) Matrix Reasoning Test Total Scaled Score
primary_outcome.description: The WAIS-IV Matrix Reasoning test is a validated, objective measure of executive function. Scaled scores range from 0 to 26. Higher scores indicate better executive function. Scores reported below are change scores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Delis-Kaplan Executive Functioning System (D-KEFS): 20 Questions Test Total Questions Asked Scaled Score
secondary_outcome.description: D-KEFS: 20 Questions Test measures executive function. The range of scores is 1 - 19 with a higher score representing better executive function. Scores reported below are change scores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Informant Questionnaire on Cognitive Decline in the Elderly-Self Report (IQCODE-SR) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: The measure examines self-reported change in cognition over time. Scores range from 16 - 80, with higher scores indicating worse functioning (or more cognitive decline). Scores reported below are change scores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cognitive Problems and Strategies Assessment (CPSA) Memory Strategies Use Score
secondary_outcome.description: CPSA measures cognitive problems and memory strategy use. The range for scores is 0 - 90, with higher scores indicating higher frequency of using memory and thinking strategies. Scores reported below are change scores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Informant Questionnaire on Cognitive Decline in the Elderly (IQCODE) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: IQCODE is a self-report questionnaire for caregivers that measures possible dementia and cognitive decline of the patient. The range for scores is 26 - 130, with higher score representing worse functioning/higher cognitive decline in the patient. Scores reported below are change scores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Memory for Intention Test (MIST) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: MIST measures prospective memory. The range for scores is 0 - 48 with a higher score representing better prospective memory. Scores reported below are change score.

secondary_outcome.measure: World Health Organization Quality of Life (WHOQOL)-BREF Psychological Domain Transformed Score
secondary_outcome.description: WHOQOL-BREF is a self-reported measure of quality of life. Transformed score for the psychological domain ranges from 0 to 100. Higher scores indicate better quality of life. Scores reported below are change scores.

The PDQ-39 is a patient-reported measure of health and quality life over a 1-month period in individuals with Parkinson's disease. Total scores range from 0 to 156. Higher scores indicate poorer quality of life. Scores reported below are change scores.

The NPI-Q is a self-reported measure of neuropsychiatric symptoms over a 1 month period and 1 year period. Total month scores range from 0 to 156. Higher scores indicate greater severity of neuropsychiatric symptoms. Scores reported below are change scores.

intervention.description: Cognitive Rehabilitation for persons with PD-MCI
Support Group for persons with PD-MCI

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Diagnosis of Parkinson's disease
2. Mild Cognitive Impairment
3. Over 40 years of age
4. Fluent English speaker
Exclusion Criteria:
Other neurological conditions (e.g., stroke) besides Parkinson's disease

overall_official.affiliation: VA San Diego Healthcare System, San Diego, CA

facility.name: VA San Diego Healthcare System, San Diego, CA

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Education
measure.description: The number of years participant received formal education

measure.title: Duration of Disease
measure.description: Time from Parkinson's disease diagnosis to enrollment
measure.population: 54 subjects were enrolled for the Supportive Care group. 1 subject was missing the information.

measure.title: Cognitive Status
measure.description: Cognitive status was determined using the Diagnostic Criteria for Mild Cognitive Impairment (Litvan et al., 2012).
measure.population: 55 subjects were enrolled into the CogSMART-PD group; however, 1 participant did not meet inclusion criteria.

measure.title: Motor Symptoms
measure.description: Timed Up and Go (TUG) Test, a motor assessment
measure.population: 54 subjects were enrolled into the Supportive Care Group; however, 1 subject dropped before their baseline assessment, and 2 were unable to complete the measure in session. 55 subjects were enrolled into the CogSMART-PD group; however, 1 subject was unable to complete the measure in session.

measure.title: Baseline Medication
measure.population: 54 subjects enrolled in the Supportive Care group; however, 1 subject's medication info was missing. 55 subjects enrolled in the CogSMART-PD group; however, 1 subject dropped before their baseline assessment.

outcome.title: Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale-IV (WAIS-IV) Matrix Reasoning Test Total Scaled Score
outcome.description: The WAIS-IV Matrix Reasoning test is a validated, objective measure of executive function. Scaled scores range from 0 to 26. Higher scores indicate better executive function. Scores reported below are change scores.
outcome.population: 54 enrolled in Supportive Care: 6 dropped before group started, 1 dropped before baseline, 2 dropped during group. Therefore, 45 completed measure. 55 were enrolled in CogSMART-PD: 3 dropped before group started and 2 dropped during group. Therefore, 50 completed measure.

event.description: Subject was surprised when neurologist administered a standard clinical motor examination to assess balance (UPDRS). As required by the exam, neurologist firmly pulled back on shoulders. Subject reported X-rays with no results.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
